Thursday, April 19, 2007























Japan gets serious about space
Japan plans to more aggressively pursue space objectives -- including a lunar landing and, possibly, manned missions in space. To raise public awareness, the Japanese space agency is conducting a "Wish Upon the Moon" campaign that allows people to send brief messages up with a lunar orbiter set to launch in August.
FULL STORY




















Free day in space
U.S. space tourist Charles Simonyi enjoyed an extra day in space on Tuesday.
FULL STORY






Astronaut runs marathon
Astronaut Sunita Williams ran her version of the Boston Marathon, running on a treadmill 210 miles above Earth.
FULL STORY






Space travel lottery
Astronaut Buzz Aldrin plans for a lottery which would send its winner into space.
FULL STORY






Shuttle flights in 2007
NASA will try to launch four space shuttle flights in 2007 to continue building the international space station, managers said.
FULL STORY
